body.p: This is a list of the known issues as of the release of version (). The most up-to-date version of this list is available from the project bug tracker.

item.text: There are currently no known issues.

body.p: This is a list of the suggested improvements as of the release of version (). The most up-to-date version of this list is available from the project bug tracker.

item.title: Support strict SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 parsing
item.text: When parsing SNMPv1 files, no symbols or constructs from SNMPv2 should be available. The opposite goes for SNMPv2 files.

item.title: Create unit tests
item.text: All the source code should be tested automatically through JUnit or a similar tool. This is a minor issue, however, as the complete library is always tested with all the IETF MIB files on each build.

item.title: Add SNMP client capabilities
item.text: The Mibble library currently has no support for SNMP agents or clients. It might be possible to integrate with the WestHawk SNMP stack to provide this.

item.title: Validate SEQUENCE element types
item.text: The types in a SEQUENCE should be validated against their counterparts if also defined separately.

item.title: Add object serialization
item.text: There is currently no easy way to store the state of a loaded Mib, so the same files have to be parsed every time which may be time consuming. By adding object serialization or similar this might be faster.

item.title: Add error recovery for missing imports
item.text: Currently Mibble reports errors and fails loading of MIB files containing symbols that have not been properly imported. This particular error is often easy to recover from, as in most cases the symbol is available from one of the MIB files already imported.
